group_1.textCenter: Um... Here...I made you some tea.

group_1.textLeft: Thank you kindly.

group_1.textCenter: T-take all the time you need...

group_1.textRight: Oh, Big Sis...
Okay, what's going on? You called me here@out of nowhere.
I only showed up because Iroha asked me@to come.

group_1.textLeft: You didn't want to see me, did you?

group_1.textRight: Of course not. Not after what you did at the@Coordinator's shop the other day...
Ouch! [chara:100770:lipSynch_0][wait:1.0][chara:100770:cheek_0][chara:100770:face_mtn_ex_030.exp.json][chara:100770:lipSynch_1]You slapped me... Why...?
You hit me with everything you had...
Oh! But that doesn't mean I'm afraid!
You don't scare me, Nayuta! Not one bit!

group_1.textLeft: Yes, I had despised you so much@that I struck you.
I admit doing so made me feel@somewhat better.
I'm sorry.

group_1.textRight: What?

group_1.textLeft: I apologize not only for hitting you,
but for the fact I haven't reconsidered@my opinion on you since we were children.
Just as I have grown and changed,@so have you.
I did not pay that fact any heed.
I've had a shallow view of you, without accounting@for your depths or the changes time has wrought.
For all of that, I am sorry.

group_1.textRight: ...I see. That's amazing.
I've said really nasty things in the past.
I didn't think you could possibly see me@any differently.
You're right, though - I've changed a lot@over the past few years.
Well, a significant difference is that@I became a Magical Girl,
but more than that, I've made many new@friends, and my heart has grown as a result.

group_1.textLeft: So I was right after all...

group_1.textRight: I think the one thing that's changed the most@is my opinion of your dad.
I now believe the study of folklore is a@visionary field that can help us all.
I admire my uncle for continuing his research@despite the criticism he receives for it.
Just as you changed your opinion of me,
I've changed my opinion on you and your dad.

group_1.textLeft: Indeed. I look forward to us working together@from here on out.
Hm?!
You seem to be in a bad mood.

group_1.textRight: I most certainly am.

group_1.textLeft: Didn't you meet with Lady Touka?
You wanted to speak with her and dispel@the preconceptions you've held...

group_1.textRight: I was foolish for thinking I could change@my mind someone like her.

group_1.textLeft: What...?

group_1.textRight: From her surface to her depths...@From the past to the present and the future...
Touka's nature will remain forever@unfixable and inescapable!
How's your dad? Still the same as always?

group_1.textLeft: Though I haven't seen him in nearly six months, he@was still conducting his research before he vanished.
He has yet to find a way to spread@the truth about Magical Girls.

group_1.textRight: Hmm...
Maybe he should start with a makeover.

group_1.textLeft: A makeover?

group_1.textRight: If you want to be accepted by the general@public, appearances are important, no?

group_1.textLeft: That's entirely unnecessary!
He's a fine man! He's perfect the way he is!

group_1.textRight: You have to think about this objectively,@Nayuta.
If you want to make a good impression,@cleanliness is critical.
But your dad grows out his hair,
and he's always dressed up like he's mucking@around in the field.
His clothes are all tattered and covered in dirt.
That's the complete and exact opposite@of being clean!
And he stinks, too! I had to hold my breath@whenever I was with him!
Now that I think about it...
Could it be that your dad's marvelous@research...
...is rejected by everyone because of@how slovenly he is?
Ow!
There's nothing about her to reevaluate.

group_1.textLeft: I see. So that's why you slapped her and@stormed back home...
Lady Nayuta...
Well done.

group_1.textRight: You and I are on the same page, then!

group_1.textCenter: I'm glad I've met such wonderful people.
